posts.name: joemost
posts.cooked:
Looking for some help in finding Double Jointed Arm Robots from this past season!

I can’t think of a ton of teams that leveraged it this past year specifically in NE (only can think of a few that I know of). So looking for some help in finding teams that utilized it around the FRC world

2630 2025 Robot Reveal Robot Showcase

2630 2025 Robot Reveal Robot Showcase

Pretty cool robot, I love the way it scores in the barge

posts.name: Skye Leake
posts.cooked:
If we are to stick to just the definition of two joints and not what double (or triple) jointed arm came to mean in 2023

Spectrum 3847 | Build Blog 2025 FRC Open Alliance

Spectrum 3847 | Build Blog 2025 FRC Open Alliance

I also guess 1323, 2910, and 329 fall into this category of double jointed arms as well, albeit with an extension in between the two joints. (Another with this architecture is 3354)

6817 had a double jointed arm too come to think of it, at least I am reasonably sure, just going off memory.

posts.name: joemost
posts.cooked:
Skyehawk:

If we are to stick to just the definition of two joints and not what double (or triple) jointed arm came to mean in 2023

yeah I guess it becomes semantics at some level because there’s usually a 3rd joint with some sort of Wrist

posts.name: joemost
posts.cooked:
Skyehawk:

I also guess 1323, 2910, and 329 fall into this category of double jointed arms as well, albeit with an extension in between the two joints. (Another with this architecture is 3354)

yeah my definition isn’t great because at some level anything with a ‘joint’ is just kinda an arm.

These jointed elevators qualify.. just not going to be something feasible for my team to turn around in a season haha

8570 built basically the same robot as 7539 this season. They absolutely clobbered us at 10K this year, it has to be one of my favorite simple robots this season.

posts.cooked: If you are not a student and need help with programming one, my new mech lib has a double jointed arm mech that still needs testing. (I haven’t documented it, other than javadocs, until its tested)

posts.name: Muaz
posts.cooked: 930 had a very cool double jointed arm this year

posts.name: Jade
posts.cooked:
4613 Barker Redbacks from Australia utilised a double jointed arm. They won the Daly division at champs.
